data.title: Best all you can eat sushi
data.text: This is by far the best all you can eat sushi restaurant that I've ever been to. The service was good and the selection of sushi rolls was great. The types of rolls were very creative and FRESH! For dinner, it's $26.99 a person. It's 22.99 at lunch. Once you are seated, you get a menu with pictures of the rolls, complete with descriptions and a check list to place your selections. There's 3 "ordering slots" but each slot allows you to place any quantity you want. It's a great way of ensuring that you don't order more than you can eat. And if you do, there's a $30 charge for not finishing your meal. Thank goodness for the different slots because by the second order, I had to throw in the towel. My favorites were the eel, salmon, albacore, shrimp tempura double fried roll, baked green mussels, Simi Valley roll, dynamite...okay, let me just say there wasn't an item that I didn't like. I will definitely be back...with bigger stretchy pants!

data.title: Awesome
data.text: Great place to eat! Awesome service, if you feel like eating some sushi this is the place to get some, local, friendly and great price

data.title: This place has totally changed...and I LOVE it!
data.text: When I first moved to Simi many years ago, Hikari was this quiet little nothing of a sushi bar. It had decent food and a very plain ambiance. However, it was not the best sushi in town so I didn't go back. One day, I suggested to my husband that we give it another try. Boy am I glad we did. It's all you can eat now, very affordable, and a lot of fun! Great music and very spirited birthday songs for those celebrating. We really enjoyed ourselves and we will be back soon!

data.title: Delicious
data.text: It gets pretty crowded as the restaurant is not very large. There are four or five sushi chefs. The staff is friendly. The price for all you can eat is reasonable.  The sushi is fresh and drink a Japanese beer.

data.title: Amazing sushi
data.text: Had the all you can eat sushi and it was great.  We sat at the sushi bar so we could see all the different rolls the sushi chefs were preparing.  All of the different rolls are included in the all you can eat option.  Beautiful and delicious rolls.

data.title: All you can eat, yummmmmmm!!
data.text: This is the best sushi bar in SIMI and the owners are sooooo nice!! The fish is always fresh and their homemade saki drinks are so incredible.

data.title: Rude
data.text:
Took my daughter there. Sat us at one end of counter. Asked to order as we ate. "Dont think they will walk down. Use order sheet."  So we did. All came Quickly in NO order. 

NEVER AGAIN. Had to get up and make an issue about a new item. The it got slow walked. Bah Humbug.

data.title: Long day and craving for sushi
data.text: I was on a business trip and was in the mood for sushi.  When I hit up Yelp this place came across with multiple reviews that were consistently speaking well of the food and raving about the AYE.  You could do up to 3 rounds and if you leave the rice behind on more than 1/2 of your sushi orders there is a surcharge of up to 50%.  So if you aren't a rice fan keep it to the sashimi.  The AYE was a great way to try some items I might not otherwise have such as the UNI (not big on what looks like brown brain).  If you are a sushi fan this place is well worth a visit if you are in the area.

data.title: good fish
data.text:
Today I was blessed with sushi for lunch and dinner, in two different towns, and with two different guests!
My previous review was a work meeting and this was a birthday dinner for my wife.

This place is in a strip mall in Simi Valley. We walked in and got the traditional yell from the chefs.
we were seated in the middle of the room which I don't usually like, but it paid off later keep reading you will get it.

I was taking pictures for this review and I think one of the staff must noticed because we were never left without a staff member standing by our table.
It was kind of a cross between feeling important and feeling like they thought we were going to dine and ditch, enough so I don't really know which one was actually our server  lol.

On to the food.
We looked at the menu and decided to go with the all you can eat menu.

We started with Miso soup for me and Sashimi salad for Elizabeth.

Warm up;
We got the "stuffed tomato" which is 2 pieces of tuna wrapped around spicy crab and  scallops next was"magnolia" also 2 pieces of salmon stuffed with spicy crab meat.
We ordered 2 quail egg shooters which is sake and soy sauce, we ordered a plate of oyster shooters which is oysters with flying fish roe and scallions on a half shell, we dumped them into the quail egg shooter walla an oyster shooter!

Main show;
Spider roll with battered soft shell crab, cucumber, avocado, daikon sprouts  and Spicy mayonnaise, rolled inside nori and sushi rice

Spicy tuna - Spicy tuna roll to deep fried cut 8 pcs with chef's special sauce

Finally we got tuna, salmon and spicy scallop Nigiri these were all great the scallops were a bit spicy for Elizabeth but i liked them.

OK, now back to the table location.
since it was Elizabeth's birthday they turned off all the lights and then disco music came on and the lights strobed like in a disco they got everyone in the restaurant to clap and brought out the cool  birthday desert made up of deep fried green tea ice cream and tempura bananas wit whipped cream.
the middle of the room was the perfect spot for the birthday part of the evening.

All of the fish was fresh and tasty, the staff was more than attentive and we will defiantly go back.

data.title: Best AYCE Sushi in Simi Valley!
data.text: Very good quality food and sooooo delicious! You can order a la carte or do the AYCE. Excellent service! You know it's good coz it is always packed. The AYCE is such a great deal, too!

data.title: Delicious Sushi
data.text:
Immediately seated at 5:30pm on a Sunday.Tried the All You Can Eat Menu. The sushi was very fresh & flavorful. There was no sashmi offered.  Plenty of wait staff & four sushi chefs working. Good service.
Restaurant began to fill up after 6pm.
(Only negative was about an hour after eating the fresh oysters on a half shell which had a strange sauce, several of us suffered a digestive system purge!)

data.title: All You Can Eat Sushi
data.text: Lots of variety and very good.  Try the flavored Saki for an extra treat.  A great value to the All You Can Eat.

data.title: Tasty food, wonderful sushi
data.text: My family went to dinner to celebrate my granddaughter's birthday.  We were there on a week night and the place was almost full by 6 pm.  The sushi chefs were busy!  The all you can eat was a pretty good deal.  I had the sushi combo dinner and my husband had the teriyaki dinner.  The other family members had sushi.  It was fresh and the presentation was pretty good!  Next time I go, it'll be all you can eat because I am definitely returning.  Lastly, in celebration of my granddaughter's birthday, they darkened the room and a complimentary dessert of green tea ice cream in mochi.  The servers often checked on us and cleared the empty plates all the time.

data.title: Fish was amazing
data.text: I had a bento box for lunch. The bento box had tuna and salmon sushi as well as the chicken teriyaki. The fish was very fresh. I would definitely eat the sushi again. The chicken teriyaki was cooked all the way but lacked flavor and needed to be grilled for a few minutes. The fish however was amazing.

data.title: Average Taste, Unappetizing Smell
data.text: After searching the area for one of the best sushi places my wife and I followed the online reviews and chose this one.  It was located on the corner of a strip mall with glass all around and a ramp leading to the door.  As we entered we were greeted by the entire staff with one swift "Hello" or perhaps it was "Welcome" it could have been "Get Out!"  I'm really not sure because it was in a foreign language but we were greeted all the same.  We were seated right away at a table in the middle sized, single room, cafe style Sushi bar.  The room was clean and the staff was quick and friendly to help out.  They offered all you can eat but since it was our first time we decided to play it safe and just try a Boston Roll and a Salmon Tempura Roll.  We tend to find that if restaurants can get the "basics" right that the more advance plates will be even better!  While waiting for our food we were "treated" to the smell of the miso soup that several other people had ordered across the room from us.  Although I have smelled this soup being served before in other Sushi restaurants I was taken aback by this particular rendition.  Smells tend to take us back to our childhood, favorite memories, and sometimes unfortunate disasters.  Have you ever had the unlikely privilege of breathing in the fumes associated with a large aquarium that is several weeks overdue of being cleaned?  You know, the kind where the green algae so coats the inner layer of glass that it is hard to see inside?  That is where this miso soup smell took me back to.  And it lingered for almost our entire lunch.  Once we were served our rolls we happily started in on them.  Overall they were nice but basic in taste.  The fish and other products tasted- less than we expected.  We have had much better tasting sushi for the same price at other sushi bars.

data.title: All you can eat sushi.
data.text: I typically avoid all you can eat sushi but needed to go here for business. It was better than I had thought. The salmon was very fresh and generous in the nigiri. The tuna was almost the opposite in presentation. The rolls were okay and the service was pleasant. If you are looking for an all you can eat sushi restaurant, then here you go.
